perturbation.original_text:
The cost of
such development shall be the Company's standard billing rates then in effect
(in addition to reimbursement of any expenses, in accordance with the Company's
standard practices), which shall be paid by MBE within thirty (30) days of
receipt of an invoice therfor.
perturbation.changed_text:
The cost of
such development shall be the Company's standard billing rates then in effect
(in addition to reimbursement of any expenses, in accordance with the Company's
standard practices), which shall be paid by MBE within sixty (60) days of
receipt of an invoice therfor.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the payment term from 'thirty (30) days' to 'sixty (60) days' introduces conflicting deadlines for invoice payment, creating ambiguity and potential disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
Basic Fee is paid to the Company directly from the carrier
which ships such package no later than fifteen (15) days following the end of
the month in which such package was shipped.
perturbation.changed_text:
Basic Fee is paid to the Company directly from the carrier
which ships such package no later than forty-five (45) days following the end of
the month in which such package was shipped.
perturbation.explanation: Modifying the payment deadline from 'fifteen (15) days' to 'forty-five (45) days' creates an inconsistency regarding when the Basic Fee payment is due, leading to potential disagreements.

perturbation.original_text:
Either party may, at its option, terminate this Agreement upon
notice to the other party if (A) the other party materially fails to comply with
any of the material terms and conditions of this Agreement and (B) if such
default has not been cured within thirty (30) days (forty five (45) days if
required by the nature of the breach) after written notice to the other party
perturbation.changed_text:
Either party may, at its option, terminate this Agreement upon
notice to the other party if (A) the other party materially fails to comply with
any of the material terms and conditions of this Agreement and (B) if such
default has not been cured within fifteen (15) days (forty five (45) days if
required by the nature of the breach) after written notice to the other party
perturbation.explanation: Changing the cure period from thirty (30) days to fifteen (15) days introduces a contradiction regarding the time allowed to rectify a breach, creating uncertainty about termination rights.
